newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Qantas rejigs WA flights due to blockade.
newsitem.headline: Qantas rejigs WA flights due to blockade.

text.p: Qantas Airways Ltd said on Thursday it had rescheduled flights to and from the state of Western Australia next week to minimise inconvenience to passengers as a result of the planned union blockade of the state.

"International and domestic flights have been rescheduled to land in Perth late on Monday evening or depart before midnight. Other flights have been rescheduled to depart or arrive after midnight on Tuesday," the airline said.
The unions announced its planned communication and transport blockade last week to begin on midnight (1400 GMT) April 28 to protest against the state's proposed labour reforms.
Qantas said the changes to services from Monday to Wednesday would effect an estimated 7,000 passengers.
"We are doing everything possible for our passengers and expect schedules to be back to normal by Wednesday afternoon," said Qantas group executive general manager aircraft operations, Doug Gillies.
British Airways Plc owns 25 percent of Qantas.
